content.webTitle: Harold Ramis: Dan Aykroyd and others share their memories

fields.headline: Harold Ramis: Dan Aykroyd and others share their memories
fields.bodyText: Harold Ramis, the film actor and director who starred in Ghostbusters and directed Groundhog Day, has died aged 69. Tributes poured in on Twitter from comedians and actors who worked with Ramis and considered him an inspiration. Dan Aykroyd co-starred and co-wrote the Ghostbusters films with Ramis. Andie MacDowell co-starred in Groundhog Day. Ramis directed Billy Crystal in Analyze This. Olivia Wilde acted with in 2009’s Year One, Ramis’s last film. He wrote, directed and acted in it. Ramis directed four episodes of The Office (US), featuring Rainn Wilson as Dwight Schrute. Comedian Margaret Cho said: In New York, fans created an impromptu tribute at the Tribeca firehouse featured in Ghostbusters. And Rick Moranis co-starred in the Ghostbusters films.
